measures.notes:
Schools work on a safe environment:

Children with complaints stay at home.
Does anyone in the family have corona? 
Even then children stay at home.

When back from holidays Children from 0 to 4 years old are allowed to go to childcare and sports.
Children aged 4 to 12 are allowed to go to school.
And they are also allowed to go to childcare and sports.

6 regions with many infections will have specific rules for events, gatherings and catering (see related sections) plus others specific that each region will communicate to the population.
Amsterdam-Amstelland
Rotterdam-Rijnmond
Haaglanden
Utrecht
Hollands-Midden
Kennemerland

In all the country the following rule still apply:

Do not forget:
Always keep a distance of 1.5 meters.
Do not go to places where it is crowded.
Sneeze and cough into your elbow.
Wash your hands often with soap.
Do you have a cold? Then stay at home!
Do you have a fever or are you short of breath? Then all housemates must stay at home.
Work from home as much as possible.

Have you been on holiday in an area with a lot of infections?

Stay at home for 10 days.
Get tested.


From June 15 traveling within Europe is possible in the following countries: Belgium, Bulgaria, Germany, Estonia, France, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal, the Czech Republic and Switzerland. Traveling outside Europe is not recommended to limit the risks of a new outbreak. 
From June 15 tourists are allowed to travel to the Netherlands this summer. But only tourists from countries with about the same situation as in the Netherlands and must adhere to the Dutch rules.

As of 1 July 2020, the Netherlands has lifted the travel ban for travelers who reside permanently in the following countries: Algeria, Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, Montenegro, Morocco, New Zealand, Rwanda, Serbia, South Korea, Thailand, Tunisia, Uruguay. For travelers from China, the entry ban will be lifted as soon as the country also allows EU citizens.
Exceptions apply for specific cases. 
The Netherlands has reintroduced the entry ban for Serbia and Montenegro on 8 July 2020.
The Netherlands has reintroduced the entry ban for Algeria on 5 August 2020 at midnight. 
Travellers arriving in the Netherlands from certain countries and regions are strongly advised to self-quarantine for 14 days. Even if you do not have any symptoms or if you have tested negative for COVID-19. This applies to anyone aged 13 and over.  You are strongly advised to self-quarantine if you're travelling from: 

Sweden
Romania
Bulgaria
Croatia
3 areas in Spain (Segrià, La Mariña-Lugo and Barcelona)
1 area in Portugal (Vale do Tejo, this includes Lisbon)
1 area in the United Kingdom (Leicester)
1 area in Belgium (Antwerp);
countries outside the EU, the Schengen area and the United Kingdom.

From June 15 traveling within Europe is possible in the following countries: Belgium, Bulgaria, Germany, Estonia, France, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal, the Czech Republic and Switzerland. Traveling outside Europe is not recommended to limit the risks of a new outbreak.

Adjusted rules apply to cafés and restaurants:

You are no longer allowed to enter a café or restaurant at midnight (midnight).
You are therefore not allowed to sit on a terrace.
At midnight the music stops.
The cafes and restaurants close at 1am.
You must be gone then.
The rules apply to indoors and outdoors.

No parties for large groups
You may not meet with a large group.
For example, to go to a cinema or the fair together.

Report a large group meeting
If more than 50 people come together, you must report this to the municipality.
For example if you are organizing a concert in a park.
The duty to report does not apply to:
restaurants and cafes
religious gatherings
supermarkets and shops
other places where many people walk.
For example markets and libraries.
The rules apply to indoors and outdoors.
Then your group may not be larger than 50 people.
So also not together to parties and drinks for more than 50 people.
